inn1.comm: full and swinging away from outside off stump, left alone
closer to off stump, but enough swing and width for Gayle to shoulder arms
better, a straighter one that lands on the seam, Gayle knows where his off stump is and brings the bat down nice and straight in defence
not as good, pitches on leg stump and Gayle easily turns that down to backward square leg for one, West Indies on the board
fuller on off stump, Chanderpaul comes forward and defends, gets an inside edge to the onside, but no chance of a run as the fielder swoops in
this one's straigher and Chanderpaul turns that past square leg for one to end the over and keep strike
an attempted yorker on off stump, Chanderpaul tries to drive and gets an inside edge down to fine leg
half-volley on off stump, easily flicked through square leg, but some poor running gets them just two, there was a third run for the taking
another half-volley on the stumps and its caressed past mid-on for four, top shot
fuller outside off stump, some swing there as Gayle shoulders arms
full outside off stump, Gayle drives that hard to mid-off, who fumbles the stop

full outside off stump, Chanderpaul walks into his drive and times that well past Sajid Mahmood at mid-off, the ball slows up near the ropes and Mahmood drives and throws the ball back in, again some lazy running gets them just two runs
full on leg stump, he looks to flick but gets an inside edge
another sumptious halfvolley on middle and leg and its easily flicked past square leg for four, too full and too straight is this bowling
oh ho, again he serves up a nice halfvolley on middle and leg, and Chanderpaul just caresses that between midwicket and square leg for four more
better, not as full and on off stump, defended back to the bowler
this one swings away from outside off stump and Chanders lets it through, yeah, I've taken enough runs from this over, he reckons
good ball, lands on the seam outside off stump and shapes in, but Gayle shoulders arms and allows it to pass
lands on that spot and moves in, Gayle opens the face and runs that past gully for one
a tad slower, theres that swing again, fuller on off stump and Chanderpul defends to mid-off
good ball, some lift too as Lewis gets this cutter to hit the same and leave him, beats him by a long way
and then the man goes and does this, a rank ball well wide of the pads, geez
thats the way, fullish outside off stump and Chanderpaul is forced to defend to point
good length on the stumps, turned to midwicket
lands outside off stump and seams away but its easily negotiated by Gayle
lands on a good length and moves away a tad, Gayle stands and gets behind it in a hurry
moves more towards middle and off and gets it to move again, Gayle hops and defends to midwicket
straighter delivery on the stumps, Gayle defends with a full face of the bat, well bowled
lands on middle and leg and rises, Gayle's caught between leaving and pulling, ball thuds into his bat and runs fine
a tad shorter and Chanderpaul mistimes the pull, it pops up in  the air but a diving Ian Bell at short midwicket cant latch onto it diving hard to his right
short and wide and its crunched hard but Collingwood at backward point pulls off a fine save diving to his left
straighter on the stumps and Gayle stands and defends back to him
lands on off stump, he defends and gets an inside edge
lands outside off stumps and seams away, Gayle is beaten
short of a good length outside off stump, Gayle stands and drives through the line, times that well past mid-off and picks up four
fuller outside off and swings in, Gayle drives but gets beaten, Read behind the stumps dives well to his right and counters the swing to collect it
lands outside off and Chanderpaul looks to run that fine, but finds a diving Collingwood at backward point again
a tad fuller on this occasion and its squeezed past gully for one this time, well placed
a fraction short, not a half-tracker by any means but Gayle thumps that past cover and mid-off, not well timed and the fielder hauls it in
fuller and with some swing, he drives but straight to cover-point
he opts for a bouncer, but at that pace it just stands up outside off and he stands up as well and swats that through square leg for four
changes his length and pace now, fuller and slower on off and its turned to midwicket
full outside off stump, defended
lands outside off stump and seams away, left alone and Read collects
full on the stumps and Chanderpaul defends in typical awkward style
full and moving across him, Chanderpaul gets on top of it and defends with a straight bat

gone! Lands around off stump and moves in, draws Chanderpaul into a shuffle and he falls over as he goes for his shot, misses everything and gets rapped on the pads in front of middle stump, all appeal and Harper raises his finger after a thought, wicket maiden for Lewis
tucks him up with one that moves in from off stump but he's quick to turn that past square leg
full and seaming away, left alone
fuller on the stumps, worked to Flintoff's left at mid-on, he moves quickly and stops it
good length on off stump, Bravo quickly into his defense, ball rolls to point
straight delivery on a good length, Bravo stands and presents a full face of the bat as he defends off the backfoot
way outside off stump and lifting, Bravo chases it but cant reach it, wide called
moves across him from a good length, Bravo's quickly into position and works that off his hips past square leg and even a running fine leg cant prevent the four, well played
fullish on middle and leg, Gayle looks to flick that but cant time it, inside edge onto the pads
straighter and not as full, Gayle stands and defends back to Lewis, he's trying to temper himself here
and if he plays shots like that, it works for him! A fullish ball outside off and his bat comes down in a smooth action and he drives past mid-off for four
fullish again but he drives to cover this time
slightly shorter this time and Gayle drives that to Mahmood at mid-off
identical delivery, this time he stands tall and looks to crunch that past cover but can only find the fielder there, who takes it on the bounce, was struck hard but into the ground
he begins well, right on the button on off stump, Bravo hurries into his forward defensive
lands on the stumps and moves into him, worked to mid-on for a quick run
slower but fuller outside off stump, left alone by Gayle
full outside off stump, Gayle drives but gets an inside edge to square leg
straigter on the stumps, Flintoff puts a little more effort into it, Gayle stands and defends to cover
straight on a good length, an impressive line being adhered to by Lewis, and Bravo stands and defends back to him
more of an off stump line, no movement, and again Bravo defends again
fuller on this occasion and Bravo drives well to mid-off for a quick single
fraction shorter outside off but still nice and straight, Bravo drives to cover
good ball outside off again, Bravo comes forward and defends
lands one on middle and leg and its well worked past midwicket and mid-on for four, top shot, ball speeds away along the turf
lands on leg stump, Gayle tries to tuck that around the corner but doesnt time it well, Read collects moving to his right but cant stop the single
hops up from a good length outside off stump, Bravo too gets up and defends
much wider this time and Bravo judges it, gets a stride forward and shoulders arms, classic Test-match scene that
lands outside off and moves into him, Bravo forward and defends, but theres two sounds there, inside edge it is
great ball, full outside off stump and good seam movement away, catches Bravo on the move as he drives and gets beaten, his feet were way off balance
thats too full and its called wide
and this one swings down leg, Bravo flicks, gets bat to it but a diving Read cant get glove on it, well timed and Bravo's got four more to his name
dead straight and well played by Gayle
again, right on the stumps and Gayle can only stand and work that straight to midwicket
good length outside off stump, defended to cover
good ball lands on middle and off and moves, Gayle forward in his defence
good length ball on the stumps once more, and Gayle defends to cover, another dot ball from Lewis
nope, this wont be another maiden as Lewis goes off line, lands one on leg stump and Gayle turns that past backward square leg, well timed and he gets four
good ball outside off stump, Bravo comes forward and defends, the inside edge rolls quite close to off stump after popping up, Bravo had no idea, smiles from Flintoff
lands outside off and moves in again, Bravo defends but the ball pops up off the pads this time
full again, this time Bravo times the drive well and gets one to mid-off, where Mahmood gets down very quickly and saves run, fires in a quick throw to boot
full outside off, but Gayle stands up and smothers that between Flintoff and mid-off, who gets a hand to it, but even the half-stop cant slow the ball down enough, well struck by the big man
again full outside off stump and Gayle drives to mid-off, calls for the quick single and gets it, good call
stands up from outside off stump, Bravo too stands and drives off the backfoot to cover
a fraction short outside off stump, Gayle stands and smacks that to Pietersen at cover on the bounce
full on the stumps, Gayle drives and gets an outside edge that flies down to third man
full on the pads, Bravo picks that up in flash and lifts that over the onside for four, easy pickings for him
slower and straighter, Bravo defends stoically
this one stands up from outside off stump, Bravo goes for an upper cut but misses, good take from Read standing behind the stumps
good length on off stump and Bravo defends back to Lewis
bad ball first-up, wide down the legside, good stop by Read
wide of off stump, left alone
wide again and he leaves it alone
closer to him, Bravo stands and defends to cover
fuller on off stump, defended to Pietersen at cover
strives for the yorker on off stump but Bravo's up to the task, gets the bat down in time
moves down leg, Bravo goes for the tickle but misses, umpire raises the arms
good ball on off moves into him, Bravo defends to mid-on, signals for Gayle to resist the run
Fullish on middle and leg but Gayle cant work it away for runs
short of a good length on off stump, Gayle stands and drives to Michael Yardy at mid-off
good length ball on middle and off, Bravo hops and drives that to Yardy, who's got a nice shiner under his right eye, a result of a biff he took while fielding in practice earlier
full and defended to the on side
full and swinging into him, ball moves too much after pitching and raps Bravo above the knee roll as he goes for an expansive drive, but that ball would have moved down leg, the umpire reckons
this one's got too much going for it as well, raps him on the back leg again, but Lewis' appeal is in vain as Harper says that was moving down leg again
well bowled, lands outside off and shapes away from Gayle's forward prod
slower outside off stump, Gayle drives back to Mahmood's outstretched right hand
full outside off stump, Gayle drives that right to Pietersen at cover, Mahmood's clipped the nonstriker's stumps as he bowled, must have hurt his fingers a little, and he's overstepped as well
full again and its driven to mid-off
drifts onto middle and leg and Bravo whips that over the infield, ball lands near the ropes and trickles over for four
lands on legstump and moves away, Read collects, wide called, and thats the 50-run stand between these two
and he pitches one more on leg stump, a full length too, and Bravo easily works that past mid-on for four more, top shot
short of a good length on middle and leg, Bravo hops and turns that past a diving square leg and calls for two, he pushes for it and gets it too
fullish on the stumps, turned to square leg

almost! A good length outside off stump, Gayle drives hard off the backfoot but the ball lands just in front of a diving Strauss at short cover, he could have dived earlier but then thats just part of the game
straighter on off stump and Gayle defends back to Lewis
lands on middle and off and Gayle drives to midwicket
drifts to leg stump and Gayle drives nicely in the gap at midwicket, gets two as Dalrymple in the deep fields and returns in a quick throw

good length on middle and off, Gayle drives back down the ground off  the backfoot and Lewis gets his left hand to it, just two from the over and thats the end of is spell, a good one after he overcame his early jitters
full outside off stump, defended
tossed up on middle and off, driven to mid-on
flatter outside off stump, driven to Collingwood at cover
some air on this one, driven back down the ground, well stopped by a diving Yardy
flatter on middle and leg, worked to the onside
tossed up outside off, but Bravo cant time the drive well enough to beat Collingwood, and its a maiden for Yardy, good stuff
tossed up on off stump, defended
dropped, tossed up again, Gayle charges and lofts over mid-on, Bell at long-on runs sideways but cant judge it well, ball pops into his throat and spills out, ouch
tossed up, Bravo's beaten on the drive
full again, driven to mid-on
moves down leg, Gayle tries to sweep but misses, ball rolls of the pads
flatter on the pads, Bravo advances and slams that past mid-on for four, good shot
drops one short and Bravo rocks back and slams that over mid-on this time, good shot for four more
tossed up on off, Bravo makes room and drives to point
flatter on the stumps, defended back to Yardy, who's second over is not as good as the first
speared down the pads, Gayle tries to sweep but cant time it well
tossed up again, driven to mid-on
flighted on off stump, spins away as Gayle tries a cheeky dab but mistimes it
tossed up on the stumps, defended
tossed up again, but on middle and leg, worked to the onside
tossed up outside off stump, Bravo nicely nudges that late past Read and gets runs as third man comes across and fields
wide of off stump but Bravo cant time the cut well enough to beat backward point
flatter on the stumps and its defended back to Yardy
little more air, Bravo onto the front foot and driving to cover
tossed up on the stumps, Bravo drives down the ground, Yardy dives to his right and gets a hand to it, ball pops out and they get one to mid-on
tossed up outside off, Gayle drives but gets an inside edge
tossed up, defended
streaky edge through the slips. Gayle tries to work a fullish ball on the middle and leg to the on side.
floated outside the off stump, steered to point
turning in from the middle, worked to short midwicket
And again. Fails to find the gap
really tossed that one up, bit too full however, and driven through covers
full and on the middle, driven back down the track, Yardy stretches his left boot out, deflects the ball away
3rd ODI fifty up for Bravo. Swept fine.
comes down the track but Yardy holds the length back and Bravo tries to turn it to on side, misses and is rapped on the pads
overpitched, driven to long-off
defended off the front foot
beaten! tossed up outside off, Bravo goes for a flamboyant square-drive but doesn't connect
beaten neck and crop. Well-flighted delivery, slower through the air, and Bravo is beaten in the flight and also by the lack of pace and is through his drive a bit early.
again Bravo gets into a bit of tangle. Slightly quicker delivery on a length and Bravo  goes for a drive, top-hand out of the handle, and ball goes in air and past the bowler, down to long-off
Fifty up for Gayle as well. He has been a bit circumspect in this knock.
overpitched and driven to wide long-off
The imposter has left and the original is back. This was Chris Gayle that we know. Down came the front foot, down came the flashing blade and up went the ball soaring over long-on
Sajid Mahmood makes a mess of a regular stop at long-on, Chris Gayle had driven a fullish ball down the ground,  and gives away a boundary
Mahmood comes into play again but this time with a neat stop. Ran to his right from long-on to stop a powerful straight drive from Gayle
Gayle keeps the strike with a push towards mid-on region
turner outside the offstump, left alone
on the leg and middle, tickled around the corner
Bravo continues to struggle against the offspinner. Tries to cut from the stumps, ends up dabbing it towards short thirdman.
floated on the off stump, driven to long-off
leans forward to a length delivery and pushes it to long-off
good cricket allround. Whiplash square-drive and it flew fast to Collingwood, at point, who makes a smart stop
almost a super catch by Struass at short-cover. Bravo forces one on the up, ends up slicing it a bit, and Struass threw himself forward but couldn't quite reach it
dabbed to thirdman
Predetermined assault is on. Gayle takes his front foot outside the line - places it outside the leg stump, opens up - and slaps a short-of-length delivery over midwicket
slower ball to man who bowls quite a few of them, driven to long-off
turns from outside the off stump, turned to midwicket
swept from the stumps to backward square-leg
turns after landing around middle and leg, tickled to Strauss at short fineleg
runs down the track but drives straight to cover. Bravo is having a few problems with the offie
gets off the strike with a tickle to left of Strauss at short fine leg
full and on the off, driven to long-off
whack..... Gayle drills a overpitched delivery straight to Dalyrmple at cover
attempted yorker, driven square to the sweeper cover
slower one, just outside the off stump, Bravo tries to push it to the off side but gets an inside edge that takes the ball to the on side. Didn't pick it early
And again. Beaten by the slower one. Full and on the legs, he ended up going through his shot a bit early and gets a leading edge which takes the ball towards mid-off
overpitched outside off, driven powerfully to widish long-off
on the blockhole, defended away
tossed up outside off, Bravo leans forward to drive it through extra cover
from round the stumps to Gayle. low full-toss on the middle, no violence from Gayle, pushes it down the ground for a single
swept from the stumps. fetches him a single

beaten in the flight and the inside-edge saves him from disaster. He ran down the track to loft but ended up getting an inside-edge. Read was getting all excited anticipating an stumping chance as the ball appeared to evade the flashing blade but ...
attempted sweep shot, rapped on the thigh pad. Drinks break.
Violence right after the drinks break. Overpitched outside the offstump - a gentle lossener - and crashed past cover
Partly edged, partly steered through the vacant slip region. Length-delivery in the zone outside off and Gayle opened the bat-face.
on the leg and middle, turned to midwicket
on the off stump line, pushed to cover. Gayle is on 86, has paced his innings pretty well.
Gayle surges on with a firm push-drive down the ground. On the middle and he off ered the full face of the bat, picked up near the ropes
Again Bravo tries to sweep, misses and is hit outside the line. He has been troubled a bit by Darylmple and has been trying to employ the sweep to get out of trouble.
slightly shorter and cut past point
Almost had Gayle there. Came down the track and the ball was held back a bit, he adjusted by going back and chopping it to short thirdman
tossed up on the middle, pushed down the ground
defended off the front foot
slpping down the leg side. Maybe he expected Gayle to give him the charge
appeal for lbw but turned down by Harper. That came in with the arm, Gayle stretched his front foot really forward and was rapped on the pad.
on the hips, whipped past square-leg
driven straight down the track, the ball made contact with bottom-half of the bat and hence couldn't gain any velocity
attempted yorker, dug out towards short midwicket
on the middle and leg, full in length, turned towards square-leg
Gayle retains the strike with a push to left of point. Collingwood moves across to make the stop.
Gayle tries to sweep but doesn't connect, ball rolls off the pads
on the leg stump line, turning in a bit, Gayle takes it on his front pad as he stretches forward in defense
oh ho! a reverse sweep!  But hit straight to Mahmood at short thirdman
on the middle and leg, coming in with the angle - he is bowling from round the stumps - pushed down the ground
Lovely whiplash-squaredrive. Slightly short and outside off, sliced past point
fuller this time, driven down the ground
The charge is truly on. Bravo backed away and drilled a straightish ball on the stumps but can't beat cover
on the middle and leg, full in length, driven straight to long-on
this time to long-off, singles coming easily
Pushed to left of mid-on and they jog through for a single
on a driveable length around the leg and middle, pushed down the ground. Looks like he will explode after he reaches his century, till then he intends to deal in singles
attempted yorker, Bravo tries to flick, is rapped on the pads
leans forward to smother the spin. Dead-bat. 100 is near Sir!&
pushes past midwicket and gets a single. Over to Bravo
Wah! he dances down the track and whips it over deep midwicket. Bottom-hand powered shot.

Read, usually such a good wicketkeeper, makes a mess of a easy stumping chance. Bravo had shooted forward and past the turning ball, all Read had to do was gather and whip the bails off but didn't gather it cleanly. It bounds off his gloves and rolls on to the stumps but by then Bravo had made his ground
driven straight back down the track, bowler makes a good tumbling stop
short and wide, cut straight to point
on the off stump line, pushed to long-on. 200 is up and Gayle is on strike
Gayle continues to display his patience. Pats back a length-delivery back to the bowler
pushes to mid-off and inches further close to the 100-run mark
Bravo brings Gayle back on strike with a forcing shot off back foot, out to deep cover
Gayle moves to 98 as he works a low dipping full-toss on his boots past midwicket
Flintoff comes back to have one final stab at Gayle before he gets his hundred. In the zone outside off, left alone
moves to 99 with a nudge towards extra cover
dab to thirdman brings Gayle back on strike. Just one run short of the century
Pushes a length-delivery on the middle to the off side, Bravo is ready to run, Gayle sends him back
That's it, Gayle's 100 is up. Flintoff gifts him a full-toss on the off,  eased past cover.  This is his 14th ODI hundred, second against England and second in this tournament
Gayle gets ready to explode after his century. Goes for a heave across, but gets an inside edge
another inside edge as Bravo tries to drive on the up

Anticlimax. Gayle has been run out before he could indulge himself. Bravo set off after pushing a length-delivery towards extra cover, Gayle hesitated initially before responding but couldn't beat the throw from Flintoff
Sarwan is beaten first ball as he tries to dab a delivery hovering around the offstump.
fine-leg was brought up and what does Collingwood do? giftwraps a delivery on the legs, accepted by Sarwan.
almost took Flintoff's head off with a airy drive. Flintoff palmed it off to save himself from injury
slightly slower on the off, dabbed to thirdman
Sarwan charges, makes contact , but drives straight to Flintoff
full and on the off, shovelled away towards cover
beaten outside off.  Played inside the line of a leg cutter.
backs away to drill a fullish ball past the bowler
full, drifts in towards the leg stump, flicked to midwicket
going going gone.......  Yeah.. Bill Lawry's trademark comment would have fitted perfectly. Sarwan backed away and sent a slower delivery soaring over long-off.
driven past cover
attempted yorker turns into a low full-toss, driven down the ground
attempts a yorker, ends up as a full-toss,  Bravo pushes it down the ground. Hint of late in swing.
almost in the blockhole, dug out to extra cover and they dash across for a single
slower one on the off stump line, steered to right of point
backs away to slap a low full-toss to long-off
slower one and driven to long-off and they run hard to complete the second run
bumper to finish off the over. Bravo pulls out of an intended pull shot.

Unlucky Anderson. He saw Sarwan backing away outside the legstump, fired in a yorker that bounded off the boot , to the right of Read, down to thirdman region! Given a four, but I think it went off the boot
Slips in a slow full toss, biffed past square-leg
another yorker goes awry and flicked away past square-leg. As easy as it gets. Lovely knock from Bravo.
And again. Just short of blockhole, gives Bravo the room to get his bat under it and he powers it straight down the ground
full and on the middle, Sarwan, again, backs away to slash it to deep cover.
slower delivery this time. Sarwan tries to dab it to thirdman, doesn't connect
dropped! Sarwan backs outside the leg stump and  scoops an intended-lofted shot but Yardy at mid-off couldn't hold on to the skier. He ran a few yards to his right.
Sarwan's nice little cameo ends. Drilled straight to Collingwood at long-on.
Pushed full and across, outside the off stump, Lara tries to slice it away, doesn't connect well
full and driven past cover
Lara backs away to push a length-delivery on the offstump past cover point
Bravo goes for a pull, doesn't connect well and the ball rolls past square-leg
Again Lara backs away, again Anderson pushes one full and across, Lara reaches out to slice it to deep point
top-edges a pull shot over the 'keeper's head. Short and rising, Bravo tries to murder it over square-leg, it flies over Read
Yorker-length delivery outside off stump beats an intened-slice shot.
cough cough.. Lara plays a ugly shot. Sorry ... that's true. He moves outside legstump and goes for one ugly hoick across the line but doesn't connect
Lovely slower delivery gets rid of Lara. Again he backed away and tried to drill a fullish ball down the ground but is beaten by the change of pace
full, fast and straight. Samuels shuffles across, tickles it to short fine-leg
Strangely Bravo doesn't go for a slog. Pushes a length-delivery to the on side for a single. Hmmm ...
almost in the blockhole, shovelled past midwicket.

inn2.comm: full outside off stump, left alone by Strauss
moves into him from outside off stump, Strauss struggles to defend, umpire warns Edwards about walking on the pitch
what a ball! Lands on off stump and swings in, just misses the top of middle stump, now thats a brave decision from Strauss to leave it alone
dead straight and nipping in, Strauss quick to defend to the on side
banged in short, Strauss doesnt time the pull well and is lucky that the ball bobbed up and landed between mid-on and midwicket
lands on off and nips in, Bell tucks that to square leg for a first-ball single, pacy over from Edwards comes to an end
begins with a widish delivery that Bell shoulders arms to
short of a good length outside off stump, Bell follows it and doesnt keep it down, ball shoots past gully and down to third man, luckily for him he found the gap
angles across him from outside stump and he leaves it alone watchfully
this one's straighter and he tucks it to midwicket where Bravo fields and shies but misses the throw and gives away four overthrows, no one backing up
a tad fuller, Bell drives to Sarwan at cover who dives to his right and does well
quick on a good length, Bell reads it and defends down into the ground
he oversteps, this one's wide of off stump and Strauss watches it pass him
fullish again and its pushed to the offside for a quick single
outside off stump, played down to third man
wide this time and Strauss tries to flay it through the offside, cant time it well
wide again and this time he gets on top of it and drives in the gap at point, ball holds up near the ropes so no boundary for Strauss
short on leg stump and its eased around the corner for one to Samuels behind square leg
short and wide, but Bell's back-foot drive cant beat Sarwan at cover, call of 'NO' and 'WAIT' back to Strauss
bad ball, wide down the pads&
drifts to leg again and its tucked off the hips to Collymore at fine leg
another poor ball swings down leg side, Baugh collects
better line, good length on off stump, Bell drops the hands and responds quickly to Strauss' call for the single as point and slip move in to collect

thats boundary No. 1 for England as Strauss whips it from middle and leg down to fine leg, where Collymore runs across and tries to show his football skills, but ends up kicking the ball over the ropes
fullish length and its defended
sumptious! Pitched up in the slot and he frees the arms with a lovely stand-and-deliver extra cover drive for four, aren't left-handers fun to watch?
this one's nice and straight and Strauss defends back to the bowler
angling down leg and Bell works that in the air down to fine leg
short and wide, Strauss cuts that backward of square and the ball races away in the gap and beats the man back there, cracking shot
fuller now and Strauss drives, but gets an inside edge back onto the boot
he oversteps, and Strauss tries to cash in on a rank overpitched delivery outside off stump but misses the drive
drifts to middle and leg, tucked to the on side but right to square leg
a tad fuller outside off stump and Strauss gets to the pitch and drives to cover for one
short of a good length on off stump and Bell hops into his defence
bang on target, a little movement back in has Strauss driving to mid-on
too full outside off and just where Strauss likes 'em, sees the length and eases into a fine cover drive for four more
angled across him with some good movement and Strauss shoulders arms
full again but this time Strauss' drive cant beat mid-off
just a tad wider but he says sorry, mate, and smashes that past a diving backward point for four, just rocked back and found the placement
better, changed to a back-of-a-length ball and Strauss defends it
another no-ball, overpitched a tad and Bell defends to point
shot! Sees the slight width on offer and joins in with a classic back-foot cut wide of point for four
lands on middle and leg and he whips that to Bravo at square leg
this one lands on a good length on the stumps and kicks, and the bounce catches Bell by surprise but he manages to keep it down by getting that bottom hand off the bat
full and he drives loosely, gets an inside edge to the onside, Bravo swoops in and they resist the sharp single
another one kicks from off stump and gets him hopping, he awkwardly keeps that down in front of point

shot of the session! Little bit of width and he's initially going front, but comes onto the backfoot and crashes a fine drive smack in the gap between cover and point, ball speeds away before a man can move
full outside off stump, defended to point
fullish and its driven to mid-off
straighter and its played to Samuels at mid-on, who shies at the stumps and is well backed up by Sarwan
steps over the line, a freebie, and Strauss duly whips the halfvolley through midwicket for another four, England on fire
straighter and it tucks him up, but he works that to midwicket
too straight on middle and leg and its driven to Lara at midwicket for one
good ball, he rolled the fingers over that one, changed the pace a tad and Bell goes back in defence
good ball, fullish outside off stump, Strauss comes forward and defends
short of a length, Strauss makes room to work that through square but doesnt time the shot
pitched up wide and he helps himself to one of those classic extra cover drives for four, just a step forward and smack, away she goes
straighter on middle and leg, worked straight to Lara at midwicket
short and wide, Strauss has a flirt and squeezes one in the air past gully for one to third man
bye bye! This one's banged in real short, Bell ducks, Baugh leaps, but its bonus runs that escape wide and down to the fine leg ropes...frustration?
better stuff now, a good length outside off stump and Bell's quick to defend to cover with a shout of 'NO' back to Strauss
full on off stump, driven back down to the bowler
nips into him from off stump, Strauss adjusts and defends to the off side
not a bad ball, but Strauss gets to the pitch of it and unleashes a superb cover drive for four, where was this attitude all tournament from England?
Dropped! Whipped from middle and leg to Gayle at short midwicket who drops it, in an out, a goof up
this lands outside leg stump and clips the pad, appealed for but ump says nope
lands on a sweet length, Bell pokes at it, not entirely unintentional and the ball races down wide of third man for four to end the over, runs coming fast here
short of a good length on middle and leg, worked to square leg for one
good length around off stump, Bell drops that in front of point but they don't run
good ball again, moved into him a little bit but he was quick to defend
moves in and raps him high on the pad, but it was sliding down leg stump
drifts to middle and leg again, Bell works that past mid-on, Chanderpaul gives chase and stops it near the ropes
again that line but he can only turn that to Bravo at square leg
from around the wicket, tossed up, spins into him from outside off stump, rapped on the pads, no reaction from the umpire
tossed up, middle and leg, Strauss flicks in the gap at midwicket down to Collymore on the ropes, and thats his 50, well played
bowled! Tossed up, changed his pace and the ball goes on with the arm, Strauss makes room but plays all over it, ball skids in and clips off stump, and cool Gayle has struck early
tossed up, Flintoff gets onto the front foot and drives to cover
tossed up again, this time he whips that past mid-on and down to Edwards who fumbles the stop
tossed up on off stump again, Flintoff works that to midwicket
short and wide, Bell stands and glides that in the gap at gully for one&
good length outside off stump, Flintoff pushes that gently to the offside and nods to Bell, and they scamper the single
good length again, Bell stands up and defends to the off side

dropped! Short and wide, Bell is caught by the extra bounce and slashes that in the air to backward point, where Runako Morton dives to his left, gets the hands to it but cant hold on, silly drop that
fuller this time and its defended back to the bowler
drifts to leg stump and its pushed past Bravo at square leg for one
flatter on middle and leg, tucked down to Morton at deep midwicket
tossed up outside off stump, Bell stretches forward to lap that to leg, gets beaten, Baugh whips off the bails, they go upstairs but replays show he was back in
tossed up again, driven past mid-on for one
tossed up again, Flintoff works that down to deep midwicket again
wider this time but Bell cant time the late cut well enough
tossed up, driven to mid-off for another single
good length on off stump, Bell hops and tucks that to midwicket
a good length outside off stump, Bell hops and drops that in front of point
good ball, lands outside off and rears into his throat, Bell hops and takes the eyes of it, ball kisses the shoulder of the bat and races past the vacant slip region for four, well bowled!
another short delivery, this time he tries the hook but can't make contact, ball sails over him and Baugh leaps to take it
back of a length this time, Bell drives to cover off the back foot
the yorker this time, but well kept out by Flintoff
good length ball on the stumps, defended back
lands on that good length again, and Bell makes room to push it to point
swings down leg stump, Bell mistimes the attempted flick, ball hits the pads
fuller this time, driven to Chanderpaul at short mid-off
fuller again, this time he gets onto the front foot and defends
fuller and straighter, Bell cant beat Chanderpaul again and its a maiden over from Collymore, well done
full outside off stump and he gets an inside edge while trying to drive
fraction shorter and wider but he can't beat the man at point
angles into the pads, but once more he can't work that fine for runs
full in the slot and he drives that dead straight as can be, ball smashes into the nonstrikers stump and prevents a certain four
middle and leg, just pushed into the onside and they run one, thats the 100 for England
short and wide, and finally he manages to beat the fielders with a fine on-the-hop cut past point and gully for four, that'll take some pressure off Bell
full outside off stump, Flintoff walks into his forward defense and follows up with a checked drive back to the bowler
quicker on the stumps and Flintoff defends back to him
slower this time on a good length, Flintoff pushes that to Lara at cover
not that full, Flintoff checks the drive and picks up a quick single to Chanderpaul at mid-off
shortish length, Bell comes forward but can't time the drive well enough, ball rolls to Lara at cover
moves in from that good length outside off stump, Bell runs that to Bravo at point
full in the slot and Flintoff smashes that dead straight down the ground for four, powerfully struck
middle and leg, and he powerfully whips that through square leg for another boundary
shorter this time, he defends but gets an inside edge to midwicket
bounces in the short delivery that sails over Flintoff's left shoulder, wide called
short and its clobbered off the backfoot in the gap between cover and mid-off, little movement, all power, hit through the line, Freddie!
middle and leg, defended to midwicket
fuller on off stump, driven in the air but on the bounce to mid-off, streaky, streaky
full and driven off the front foot back to Collymore
full again on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
short and its driven off the back foot to cover where Sarwan dives and stops
short of a good length, Flintoff makes room and walks down the pitch, drives to cover though
angled into middle and leg, Bell works that through square leg
moves into him and he cant counter the swing, ends up with an inside edge
tossed up outside off stump, Flintoff makes room and late cuts that past slip for four, Bravo dives but cant get to it
tossed up on off stump, defended
flighted again, worked to midwicket

Gayle strikes again! Tosses one up, Flintoff's eyes light up, down and across comes the bat, a big swing of the arms but he can only find Taylor down at long-on, and the perennial partnership-breaker spins out another
tossed up, driven down to long-off

got 'em first ball! Gayle! Sends down a flatter one but it still deceived Collingwood in the length, it was the arm ball, and he poked at it and got a regulation edge to Bravo at slip, thats two quick wickets in a jiffy, Gayle's the man of the moment but you have to question Flintoff's needless slog
moves into middle and leg, tucked to Sarwan at midwicket
short and wide, Bell stands and cuts to Bravo at backward point
straight and full, Bell drives with a flourish to mid-on
same ball and this time he drives in the air to mid-on
good length ball outside off, Bell runs that in the vacant gully region for one down to third man, thats a good over again from Collymore
tossed up, Bell comes forward and turns that to Sarwan at midwicket
tossed up again, he works that to midwicket again
flatter trajectory outside off stump, driven to mid-off
spins outside off stump, Bell cuts and gets an edge to the 'keeper, who cant hold on, ball was dipping on him
flighted and driven to Lara in the covers
short and its cut deep into the covers for a well-run brace
good length on off stump, Bell defends and gets an edge down to wide of third man
full and its driven to point
good length ball, Pietersen walks into that and drives back to Collymore
good length ball again, almost in that channel of uncertainty, and KP drives into the cover
good ball again in that corridor and he's beaten on the drive, well bowled
this one moves in sharply and he manages to survive courtesy of the inside edge onto the back pad, good bowling this from Collymore
tossed up, beaten on the drive
tossed up again, Pietersen lap-sweeps that from outside off stump down to fine leg
again he sweeps that down to Collymore at fine leg, just the one this time
flatter and he goes back and works that to midwicket
goes back and beats square leg, Collymore moves around and fields
tossed up, Pietersen drives to long-off
outside the off stump line, Pietersen leans forward to push it towards mid-off
Shovelled just out of the reach of the mid-on fielder. He leant forward to a back-of-length delivery and swatted it away. A Bottom-hand powered shot.
in the zone outside off, Baugh is standing up to Collymore, left alone
came in a touch after landing around middle and leg on a length, Pietersen tried to work it to the on side, doesn't connect properly and the ball rolls off the pads
Good surprise bouncer from Collymore, Pietersen adjusts to swat it over midwicket. Good cricket allround
floated on the middle, turned to midwicket
And again.  Gayle is right on the money
on the off stump line, turns in, pushed back to Gayle
Another choking line on the middle, pushed to Lara at midwicket
Tight over comes to an end. Gayle offered no pace to work around with, and Pietersen chose to play safe.
Bell rings the room service. Samuels answers with a short and wide one, cut to cover fence.
Bell rotates the strike with a firm push down the ground
fuller and on the off and middle, pushed back to the bowler
And again. Samuels beginning to get his radar right
turns in from off stump line, worked around to Lara at midwicket
fuller and on the off stump line, punched back down the track
full and driven down the ground to long-on
Pietersen again pings Lara at midwicket. No chance of a run.
bottom-hand comes into play and the ball is turned to the on side but again straight to Lara at midwicket
deja-vu at Motera. Again one on the middle, again worked to Lara
again Lara comes into play but this time Pietersen had gone down the track and placed the ball to right of Lara
upto the pitch of the ball and driven past midwicket
overpitched, driven to long-off
Bell tries to repeat the Pietersen shot off the previous ball but Samuels gets across to stop
on the middle and leg, Bell works it with the turn past midwicket
Pietersen gets one past midwicket to bring Bell on strike.
will remain on 49 as he can't beat midwicket with his nudge
comes down the track to send one past Gayle but hits straight to him
succeeds this time and drives to long-on.
tossed up on the off stump line, nudged towards midwicket
turns from middle, Bell works it with the spin to backward square-leg
Bell brings up his 7th ODI fifty with a wristy flick past square-leg. Well played Sir!
Pietersen goes for a falling sweep shot but doesn't connect. Tried to fetch if from way outside off.
on the off, driven to cover
tossed on the offstump line, driven back to the bowler

Death knell for Bell. Pietersen pushed a fullish-delivery towards Lara at midwicket and Bell set off immediately. But Lara swooped in for the kill and fired in a throw at the striker's end. Caught just short of the crease. England stutter badly after a terrific start
reverse sweep. Hmm...  gets him off the strike.
tossed up, driven to long-on
really flighted delivery, slow through the air, dead-batted away
on the middle, tickled to left of midwicket where Sarwan makes a tumbling stop
slightly shorter, punched past midwicket
arm-ball, no angle to work with, drifting in towards the middle, and no pace to work with as well and Yardy just pushes it down the track
full in length, on the off, pushed back to the bowler
pushed that through a bit quicker, driven square to deep point
flight but no turn and driven uppishly towards long-off
turn but no flight this time, scrambled seam and Pietersen pushes it to right of midwicket
tossed up on the off ,driven to long-off where Bravo fumbles and they turn back for the second
drifts on to the leg, nudged around the corner. Easy pickings.
floated from round the stumps, pushed back down the track
clever stuff from Gayle, No pace nor angle to work around with. Again, dead-batted away
weak appeal goes up as Yardy is rapped on the pads while trying to work to the on side
flight and turn and usually the combo is deadly. Beats Yardy. Landed outside off and Yardy shaped up for a drive but is beaten in the flight and then by the spin off the turf
steered to point. Gayle finishes his tight spell. Great day with the bat and ball for him.
on the middle and leg, nudgedo left of midwicket
comes down the track to whip it past midwicket
arm-ball, drifting in from just outside off, pushed back down the track
pulls out the reverse sweep but straght to short thirdman. He doesn't give it all while doing that, uses it to get a single. Not much force, usually tries to place it in the gaps.
low full-toss but Pietersen can't put it away. Pushes it to midwicket for a single.
one slip in place for Yardy who pushes a length-delivery on the leg and middle towards mid-on for a single
Pietersen walks across a bit to whip a length-delivery on the off stump past square-leg!
Yardy, who stands well outside the leg stump before shuffling across ungainly, tries to pull  but doesn't connect and it rolls off the body.

More drama as Pietersen is first hit on the inner thigh and then thinks there is a run when there isn't but hurls himself back into the crease in time.  Went for a pull shot but was beaten by the lack of bounce, then sets off for a run and Collymore rushed across looking for a possible run-out chance but Pietersen came to his senses. Just in time.
fires in a yorker, dug back down the track.

Yardy falls. Not a tourist sight. What was he thinking? He came ambitiously down the track but didn't know what to do after getting there. Just scooped it high towards long-off for Bravo to run in and take the 'catch'. Doubt there whether Bravo took it cleanly or not, Yardy has walked off the field. England slip further into crisis. Replays reveal  that it was clearly a bumped catch! Ball slipped through the fingers of Bravo, hit the ground before he finished the 'catch'. Hmmm....  post-match press conference should be interesting
just outside the off stump, nudged to short thirdman
swing and a miss. Pietersen goes for a pull but doesn't connect. whizzes above the off stump
short-of-length delivery on the middle and leg, punched past midwicket
slightly short of length, on the leg and middle, tickled to long-leg
Pietersen biffs a length-delivery cleanly over mid-off. He knifed through the line and up went the ball towards the long-off boundary
Wide given as Edwards slips one full down the leg side. Went for the yorker but it slipped out of his hands
Ah... top-edges the extra ball over the 'keeper's head. Banged in short by Edwards, Pietersen pulls off the front foot and it flies high over Baugh's head. Four valuable runs.
beaten by the arm-ball. He played for the non-existent spin but ...
steered to cover point
full, drilled down the ground, out to long-on
doesn't connect his reverse sweep.
Ah.. does it this time. Gets a boundary. Tossed up outside the offstump and he took it on the full and revere swept it fine.
Pietersen drives, Edwards stops it rather the ball hits Edwards. It was hit powerfully and it thudded into the legs of Edwards
What a shot! Four crucial runs. Overpitched on the middle and leg and that bottom-hand powered drive sends the ball past midwicket.
late-swinging yorker, dug out towards the mid-on region. Well bowled and well played.
length delivery on the off, pushed to point.
attempted yorker turns into low full-toss, tries to work it around, runs off the pads

In an effort not to ping Pietersen's legs, Edwards pushed this one outside the offstump but ended up pushing it bit too wide and down came the flashing blade to slice it over point. Fifty up for Pietersen. Will he take England home? or ...
Dalyrmple goes for his favourite reverse sweep, misses.
And again. but this time it runs off the pads for a single
full and on the middle, punched down the ground
comes down the track, Samuels holds back the length and also pushes it a bit slower, swatted around to short fine leg

Not a clever shot in the circumstances. With Pietersen still standing at the other end, Dalrymple goes for a inside-out drive over cover. But no contact and the furniture is disturbed. Crucial strike .
Bravo starts off with a slower one and almost sucked Pietersen into a fatal drive. He checked his shot and ballooned it over bowler and the men at deep
another slower one, pushed back down the track
fuller and faster, dug out towards long-on.
Pietersen continues to ring in powerful blows. Another crucial boundary. A low full-toss dismissed over midwicket. As long he is there.. England have a chance
almost in the blockhole, driven to long-off
Bravo almost pulls off a super return catch. A slower one had Read pushing a bit too early and it was going way to his right but Bravo hurled himself gamely towards it... It fell well short though
turning in from outside off, pushed away to off side
on the middle and off, driven with the spin, out to long-on.
he comes down the track to whip it to widish long-off.
again he runs down the track, Samuels hurls in a low full-toss, pushed past square-leg. They run hard to come back for two.
yorker-length delivery from Samuels,  well dug out by Pietersen, out to cover
retains the strike with a drive to long-on.
full, almost on the blockhole, driven to long-on
Bravo produces another of his special slower ones. Almost had Read there. Plays too early but scoops it in no-man's land at mid-off
way outside the offstump, Pietersen tries to reach out for it but..
Pietersen hoicks a slower one out to deep midwicket.  Couple of bounces to Samuels. Just a single. Read on strike.

Bravo finally gets Read with his slower one. He failed to pick it up on two previous occasions but this time it is fatal. Straight to Gayle at short midwicket. Read tried to roll his wrists at the last minute to keep it down but ...
short and wide, rank bad delivery, Mahmood cuts and cuts well. Two runs. Pressure is released.
Bravo falls back on his slower one, slightly short, Mahmood goes back, cuts but straight to point
comes down the track, Samuels fires it in full and on the middle and leg, Pietersen tries to work it to on side, doesn't connect properly and the ball runs off the pads
Streaky edge but it would do for Mahmood and England. Flat and fast, just outside off and the edge is produced.
Almost scoops up a catch. Too early into his drive and spoons it up in the mid-off region.
Pietersen pushes a fullish delivery to Lara at short midwicket, sets off for a run, turns back as Lara swoops in. The throw deflects off the stumps and they take the overthrow
nudged to short thirdman and Pietersen will be on strike
retains the strike with a drive to long-off.
Chinese-cut for boundary! Pietersen goes for a heave across the line, gets a lucky inside edge. Oohs and aahs from the fielders, Pietersen won't be complaining.

take that! Bit of room outside off and Pietersen drills it past point.  Taylor was the hero  for Windies against Australia, Lara must be hoping he can do a repeat but Pietersen is hell bent on celebrating on this night.
powered down the ground to long-on and they run hard for two.

It does look like England's night. Yorker drifts in on to the legs and bounds away off the boots. 15 runs so far in this over. three boundaries - one inside-edge, a blistering square-drive, and one legbye.
overpitched outside off, driven square to deep point
oh ho! Umpire Taufel gives a legbye but that looked pretty plumb. A slower one, full on to the boots of Mahmood who didn't pick it
Fired in full and fast on the middle, almost yorker-length,  turned to deep midwicket
Fired in full, Mahmood punches it down the ground and it bounces over Bravo's head, he tries gamely to pull it down but ends up palming it over
That slower ball again, Pietersen pushes it back to the bowler
Pietersen pushes England closer to win with a power-packed extra cover drive. Full and in the slot and he drilled it past cover

Wow! what a shot! Bravo sends the slower ball, Pietersen was waiting for it and goes for lofted-drive on a bended knee. There was a long-on waiting but he could only be a mute witness to the thundering drive as it sailed over the ropes. The scores are level
full and outside off, Mahmood goes for a square-drive, and it appeared to be the matchwinning shot until Morton at point threw himself to his left to make the stop
slower one, on the middle, Mahmood adjusts, tries to pull but its a weak shot and the ball rolls to square-leg
England will leave India with a consolation win after all. Attempted yorker turns into a low full-toss, Mahmood punches it past square-leg to trigger the fireworks.
